intro: Aegiphila odontophylla, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant features small, gray-green leaves with a distinctive hairy texture, and it produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It is part of the Verbenaceae family and is often used in xerophytic landscaping due to its drought tolerance. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
